items.title: South Australian election countdown officially begins, campaign kicks off

items.title: I had a miscarriage over the summer. It was nothing like I expected

items.title: Why economists hate low unemployment for inflation

items.title: Heat and fires expose ancestral remains in Victoria's north-west
items.summary: Ancestral remains that could be thousands of years old have been uncovered by erosion, dust storms and bushfires in Victoria.

items.title: After the uprising, Bangladesh returns to the ballot with its wounds still open
items.summary: Bangladesh is heading back to the ballot box in what is being billed as its first free and fair election in more than a decade.

items.title: How the Liberals will justify Sussan Ley's ousting
items.summary: A permission structure has been crafted for Liberals to ditch the first woman to lead the federal party room before she has even had a year in the role.

items.title: The moment turtle Terry was released from Sydney Harbour
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: Trump endorses Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi ahead of Japan's election
items.summary: One of Sanae Takaichi's first engagements after she was elevated to prime minister in October was to host Donald Trump in Tokyo.

items.title: Golden bandicoot numbers triple at Newhaven Wildlife Sanctuary in Central Australia
items.summary: A population of threatened golden bandicoots is booming at Newhaven Wildlife Sanctuary, north-west of Alice Springs.

items.title: The easiest way to clean your microwave and a common mistake to avoid
items.summary: When was the last time you cleaned your microwave? According to experts, it's actually a lot simpler than cleaning other appliances.

items.title: French authorities sink tonnes of cocaine bound for Australia, then release suspects
items.summary: French authorities intercept a ship carrying five tonnes of cocaine bound for Australia, before releasing the vessel and its crew.

items.title: Oscar Piastri defends McLaren and says he expects 'fair shot' at F1 title in 2026
items.summary: Oscar Piastri insists the painful ending to his F1 title bid last season has only strengthened his resolve to be the "nice person" who brings the Formula 1 world drivers' crown back to Australia.

items.title: Democrat victory in Republican stronghold could spell trouble for Trump
items.summary: The US has been gripped by cold weather in recent weeks, but pundits say it is in Texas where hell has truly frozen over. A blue wave just swept a GOP stronghold, and Republicans are very worried.

items.title: K'gari traditional owners hold smoking ceremony for Piper James on beach where she died
items.summary: K'gari traditional owners have held a smoking ceremony for Piper James, who died on the island last month, to give her spirit a safe passage home.

items.title: Police lecture teen caught driving 189km/h on Sunshine Motorway at midnight
items.summary: The teenager on his P-plates was pulled over by police along a Sunshine Coast motorway driving at almost 200km/h.

items.title: Diamonds eye timely glimpse of Jamaica in Test series ahead of Commonwealth Games
items.summary: Australia's netballers expect to gain precious intelligence ahead of a showpiece tournament when they host Jamaica in a three-Test series.

items.title: Greens link Hospitality Tasmania's donations to Liberals to pokies card demise
items.summary: The Tasmanian Greens have accused the state's peak hospitality group and the Liberal Party of a "political stitch-up" to kill off the proposed mandatory pokies card, after hundreds of thousands of dollars in donations were revealed.

items.title: Formula 1 driver Jack Doohan signs with Haas as reserve driver after leaving Alpine
items.summary: Former Alpine racer Jack Doohan signed with Haas as a reserve driver for the 2026 Formula 1 season.

items.title: Belinda Bencic and Elina Svitolina make history as two mothers sit in WTA top 10 for the first time
items.summary: For the first time in women's tennis, two mothers are ranked inside the world's top 10 simultaneously.

items.title: More children suffering serious injuries on e-scooters, study shows
items.summary: Between 2021 and 2024, e-scooter injury-related admissions at Queensland Children's Hospital more than doubled, the study found, with young boys accounting for three-quarters of admissions, with a median age of 13.

items.title: ACT election data suggests neither Liberal nor Greens voters would want a coalition between the parties
items.summary: Greens voters overwhelmingly preference Labor over the Liberal Party across the country — and a look at the data from the 2024 ACT election suggests there's no reason to think that would be different in Canberra.

items.title: Australia's Cam Myers becomes youngest ever winner of Wanamaker Mile indoor race in New York
items.summary: Australia's Cam Myers becomes the youngest ever winner of the prestigious Wanamaker Mile, with the 19-year-old powering to victory in New York.

items.title: From Sabalenka to Djokovic and 'animals in the zoo', here are the best quotes from the Australian Open 2026
items.summary: From tennis stars pushing for more privacy, to Djokovic saying he feels like an old man and a Kyrgios F-bomb, there have been some funny and weird quotes at this year's Australian Open.

items.title: Novak Djokovic praises Carlos Alcaraz after Spaniard wins first Australian Open title
items.summary: Despite the hollow feeling of defeat, 24-time major winner Novak Djokovic heaps praise on Carlos Alcaraz following the Spaniard's history-making Australian Open victory.

items.title: Novak Djokovic drops retirement hint, suggests 2026 could be his final Australian Open
items.summary: Novak Djokovic did not go into detail on what he meant, nor did he confirm a plan to retire this year, but he chose his words carefully on centre court.

items.title: Clive Palmer rejects Steve Bannon influence claim in latest Epstein files
items.summary: Clive Palmer denies newly surfaced claims that his 2019 federal election campaign was influenced by a senior advisor to US President Donald Trump.

items.title: Inside the brand strategy behind the Beckham family drama — and who controls the narrative now
items.summary: In a modern crisis, experts say control doesn't always come from speaking louder — but from knowing when, where and how briefly to speak at all.

items.title: Myanmar election won by military-backed party in widely condemned poll marred by violence
items.summary: The military's political party wins the vote in a result regarded as a forgone conclusion, with critics arguing threats and violence forced people to the ballot box in a country wracked by civil war.

items.title: Bruny Island to get childcare solution but too late for the Archers
items.summary: After fighting for years for a childcare solution for her community, Teisha Archer says the news it will be happening is "wonderful" — but will come too late to help her and others in her situation.

items.title: Beckham saga is an age-old heartache with an uncomfortably modern twist
items.summary: Cutting ties with your parents isn't a new phenomenon but having it painstakingly documented across social media is a contemporary problem.

items.title: Genetically modified purple tomatoes bound for fruit shops after regulator approval
items.summary: The purple tomato was altered to make it taste better and boost nutrition.

items.title: Queensland farm cashing in on US wellness industry demand for camel milk
items.summary: Camel milk is in hot demand in the wellness industry, now one Queensland farmer is seizing the moment.

items.title: Coalition chaos drags on ahead of first official sitting week
items.summary: Former prime minister John Howard once observed that Pauline Hanson was an "electoral gift to the Labor Party". His words proved relevant this week as the Coalition's chaos dragged on.

items.title: David Speirs sees 'pathway' to standing for election amid eligibility questions
items.summary: Former South Australian Liberal leader David Speirs says there is a way he could stand for the upcoming state election — but is yet to declare whether he will — despite the electoral commission declaring he is ineligible.

items.title: Woman discovers Holocaust descendants through DNA testing
items.summary: Adriana Turk grew up believing there were no survivors on her Jewish father's side after World War II, but a DNA test showed that was not the case.

items.title: A generation of activists like Grace Oo are taking up arms against Myanmar's military
items.summary: As Myanmar's military junta seeks international legitimacy through elections, its brutal repression of the pro-democracy movement is radicalising a new generation of activists.

items.title: Majority of NSW beaches shut amid shark attacks to reopen for Australia Day long weekend
items.summary: Heatwave conditions and Australia Day long weekend activities are expected to draw crowds back to the water after a dangerous 48 hours on the New South Wales coast.

items.title: To Lam wins second term to rule Vietnam through 2030
items.summary: Vietnam's leader To Lam has been re-appointed as head of the ruling Communist Party for the next five years, and pledges to turbocharge growth in the export-reliant nation.

items.title: Fiji police allegedly seize $780m cocaine shipment in drug operation targeting Pacific Ocean 'narco sub'
items.summary: Fijian chiefs reported suspicious activity along their stretch of coastline to law enforcement agencies — which then swooped on an alleged $780 million drug operation.

items.title: Crime gangs restocking shops 'up to 10 times a day' with illegal cigarettes and vapes, WA police say
items.summary: WA's police commissioner says the restocking is happening faster than authorities can seize the products, as tobacco black market violence escalates.

items.title: Four arrested as Queensland Police seize guns, kilos of drugs in Townsville
items.summary: Police find 100kg cannabis, 8kg of methamphetamine and 1kg of cocaine as well as illegal firearms hidden in bush at a Townsville property.

items.title: Queensland Police seize firearms, drugs in Townsville bust
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: Sam Short's small leap to ocean swimming and the prospect of more Australian success in 2032
items.summary: Sam Short will take on the country's best open water swimmers at the Australian Nationals this week, with a possible new event for Brisbane 2032 opening new opportunities for Australian gold.

items.title: World champion Shelley Taylor-Smith runs swim group for women at Mettams Pool
items.summary: They call themselves the "Sea Shells Teabaggers" — and with marathon swimmer Shelley Taylor-Smith at the helm, this ocean swim group has built something much stronger than good technique.

items.title: SpaceX capsule begins return to Earth from International Space Station with sick astronaut on board
items.summary: The Crew Dragon capsule has undocked from the International Space Station carrying four astronauts, one of whom has a "serious medical condition", and is on its way back to Earth.

items.title: Former A-League player Josh Cavallo alleges Adelaide United was homophobic
items.summary: Australia's first openly gay male professional footballer, Josh Cavallo, has alleged his former club was homophobic, something it denies.

items.title: Australia wins World Cross Country Championships relay gold after Jessica Hull's anchor leg
items.summary: Olympic medallist Jessica Hull guides Australia home in the mixed relay event at the world titles in Florida.

items.title: Sixth man charged after livestock carrier allegedly used for cocaine drop in WA waters off Lancelin
items.summary: A sixth man is charged over an alleged plot to import half a tonne of cocaine into Western Australia using an international livestock carrier.

items.title: Ousted Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro and wife Cilia Flores plead not guilty in New York court
items.summary: Nicolás Maduro and Cilia Flores, who were captured in Caracas at the weekend, face multiple drugs and weapons charges.

items.title: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro held in New York prison described as 'hell on earth'
items.summary: The facility where detained Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro has been taken is a notorious New York jail that has held a string of high-profile and celebrity criminals, from drug cartel leaders to hip-hop stars.

items.title: Zohran Mamdani sworn in as NYC mayor with midnight subway oath
items.summary: Zohran Mamdani is officially sworn in as major of New York City in a midnight, underground ceremony, with a more public affair to take place in hours time on the steps of City Hall.

items.title: Swan Hill tobacco shop rammed in failed firebomb attempt as tobacco wars continue
items.summary: A tobacco shop is rammed with a vehicle weeks after receiving a shakedown note demanding the owner "contact the commission".

items.title: WA farming community loses 500 sheep, thousands of hectares of crops in fire
items.summary: A bushfire emergency in Warradarge is over, but farmers say the work to recover what was lost has only just begun.

items.title: Runner Nancy Dickman, 83, prepares for her next marathon at 90
items.summary: Nancy Dickman has run marathons in London, New York, Rome and Sydney, and at 83 shows no signs of slowing down.

items.title: Despite warnings from Donald Trump, the push for Israeli control over the West Bank continues
items.summary: Despite US President Donald Trump's objections to the annexation of the West Bank, new settlement projects are approved, with some Israelis excited while Palestinians are left fearful.

items.title: Sisters in Sweat — the Sunday football session that grew a sporting movement of over 15,000 Indian women
items.summary: Eight years ago, Swetha Subbiah was asked to run a single football session for a friend. She ended up starting a sporting movement, which now has 15,000 women and girls as members across Bengaluru, Mumbai, Hyderabad and Delhi.

items.title: Farmers' Facebook group racks up 100,000 followers as they seek support across seasons
items.summary: A group dedicated to Australian grain farming created more than a decade ago has just cracked 100,000 followers with about 20,000 people following from overseas.

items.title: Bondi Beach shooting gunman Naveed Akram was follower of pro-Islamic State preacher Wisam Haddad
items.summary: At least one of the gunmen who killed 15 people in Sunday's Bondi Beach terrorist attack was known to authorities as a follower of a notorious Sydney pro-Islamic State cleric, the ABC can reveal.

items.title: ASIO examined Bondi Beach gunman Naveed Akram in 2019 for close ties to Islamic State cell
items.summary: Australia's domestic intelligence agency, ASIO, examined one of the Bondi Beach gunmen six years ago for his close ties to a Sydney-based Islamic State terrorism cell, the ABC understands.

items.title: Iron deficiency is a challenge for many female athletes, like Super Netball's Zara Walters
items.summary: Zara Walters felt tired, dizzy and unable to recover from training sessions — then she found out she was low in iron. It's a condition that often goes undiagnosed, especially in female athletes.

items.title: Trump's quietly released national security document didn't escape Europe's attention
items.summary: When the White House quietly released its national security strategy late one night last week, it instead seemed to get lost in other news. Except, perhaps, in Europe.

items.title: Rare brain illness could not stop Milly from making country netball history
items.summary: A rare brain illness left Milly Brock unable to walk or speak, but eight months later, she was back leading her regional netball club on grand final day.

items.title: Oscar Piastri praised as future formula 1 world champion by rivals
items.summary: Oscar Piastri's chief rival, new formula 1 world champion Lando Norris, says the Australian will "get the better of me" after their tension-filled title race decider in Abu Dhabi.

items.title: Where Oscar Piastri lost the Formula 1 world championship, McLaren teammate Lando Norris claims ultimate prize
items.summary: Oscar Piastri missed out on winning the Formula 1 drivers world championship by just 13 points to his teammate Lando Norris, the culmination of multiple small moments throughout the season that cost him dearly.

items.title: Concerns for the future of Canberra's public pools amid closures and redevelopments
items.summary: As temperatures soar, advocates of public pools in Canberra say they want to see greater support and investment for facilities in the national capital.

items.title: Oscar Piastri qualifies third for Abu Dhabi F1 Grand Prix, behind rivals Max Verstappen and Lando Norris
items.summary: Oscar Piastri warns he's not out of the Formula One title hunt yet, even if many only now have eyes on a Lando Norris-Max Verstappen duel for the crown.

items.title: Oscar Piastri misses first practice at Abu Dhabi Grand Prix, finishes 11th in second session behind Lando Norris
items.summary: Lando Norris makes the best start of the title contenders in practice at the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix as Oscar Piastri endures a disappointing day.

items.title: Today in History, December 6: The day scientists found evidence of water on Mars
items.summary: Scientists said at the time that the flow of water would have filled multiple swimming pools.

items.title: What time is the F1 Abu Dhabi Grand Prix and how to watch Oscar Piastri in championship race
items.summary: The Formula 1 world drivers' championship has gone down to the wire, with three drivers set to battle it out for glory at the season-finale Abu Dhabi Grand Prix.

items.title: F1 title contender Oscar Piastri non-committal about helping Lando Norris win in Abu Dhabi
items.summary: Oscar Piastri dodges the question of whether he might help Lando Norris lift the world F1 title in Abu Dhabi, saying McLaren has not discussed the issue.
